properties.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 7 at 3:58AM EST until February 7 at 7:00PM EST by NWS Binghamton NY
properties.description:
* WHAT...Mixed precipitation. Additional snow accumulations of 2
to 4 inches and ice accumulations of a light glaze. Winds
gusting as high as 40 mph.

* WHERE...In Pennsylvania, Northern Wayne and Wyoming counties.
In New York, Delaware county.

* WHEN...Until 7 PM EST this evening.

* IMPACTS...Travel could become difficult. Blowing snow may reduce
visibility this afternoon. Scattered power outages possible this
afternoon to evening.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Rain mixes with sleet and freezing rain
beginning late morning, and then changes to accumulating snow
between 11 AM and 2 PM. Snowfall rates may exceed 1 inch per
hour at times. Snow diminishes in afternoon, but gusty northwest
winds may cause blowing snow. The combination of winds, with
weight of new snow and ice, may lead to some power outages.
properties.instruction:
Slow down and use caution while traveling.

The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can
be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

The Pennsylvania Department of Transportation and Pennsylvania
Turnpike Commission remind motorist to adjust speeds based on
driving conditions as winter weather impacts Pennsylvania
roadways. Visit www.511pa.com for the latest travel, roadways,
and traffic conditions.

NWSheadline: WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM EST THIS EVENING
